sentences.sContent: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.sCn: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.sContent: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.sCn: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.sContent: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
...I finally had to admit that my bad habits had less to do with new-age...
...No business likes to admit that it sells addictive poison as a lifestyle choice...
...Does it follow that we should admit anybody who wears shoes...
...and they aren't afraid to admit they don't know something...
...What do scientists readily admit according to the speaker...
...but you must admit the world’s a very different place now...
...it is often more acceptably in our society to be sick and to seek medical help than it is to admit that one can not cope with the stresses of life...

remMethod.val: ad ＋ mit(送) → 能送进去 → 准许…进入

words.tran: 可容许的；可采纳的；可接受的
承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

trans.tranOther: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
